abstract.para: MariaDB is a high-performance, open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) that was created as a community-developed fork of MySQL to ensure the software remains free and accessible under the GPL license.

topic.para: MariaDB follows the balanced life cycle – only LTS MariaDB releases are supported.
Each &suselinux; minor version gets a new version of MariaDB. This version is supported for the whole General support or LTS period. Starting version of MariaDB is 11.4.5.
Minor version updates, aligned with upstream releases, are provided exclusively for the mariadb and mariadb-connector-c packages.
